value.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
value.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

value.title: Extract insights from videos with the Video Indexer service
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the Video Indexer API to upload, index, retrieve insights, and search for content in video files.

value.title: Get started with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Explore Azure DevOps capabilities and get started setting up your own organization knowing what separates elite performers from low performers.

value.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Use Azure Active Directory to you secure your internal, external, and customer identities.

value.title: Introduction to Linux on Azure
value.excerpt: Discover the unique benefits of running Linux on Azure, and how to run Linux-based applications and workloads in the cloud with Azure.

value.title: Manage access to an Azure subscription by using Azure role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to assign management access to a subscription by using Azure role-based access control.

value.title: Recognize and synthesize speech
value.excerpt: Learn how to recognize and synthesize speech by using Azure Cognitive Services.

value.title: Translate text and speech
value.excerpt: Automated translation capabilities in an AI solution enables closer collaboration by removing language barriers.

value.title: How to build and deploy a containerized app to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jay Gordon (@jaydestro) joins Donovan Brown (@donovanbrown) to show how to build a containerized React application and deploy it to production with Azure Kubernetes Service. He'll also show how to configure an Azure Active Directory service principal to enable Role-Based Authentication, which enables
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E9YWmbUb9Ps" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to choose which services to use in Azure | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this video, Azure MVP Barry Luijbregts chats with Scott Hanselman about how he goes about choosing the right services in Azure to run his applications and store his data.   For more information, see:  • Overview of Azure services https://aka.ms/azfr/435/01  • Pluralsight course: Microsoft Azure for

value.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

value.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Create a language model with Language Understanding
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model.

value.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
value.excerpt: Learn about SRE, an engineering discipline that helps you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
value.excerpt: "Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure"

value.title: Manage device identity with Azure AD join and Enterprise State Roaming
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage device identity by using Azure AD join and Enterprise State Roaming.

value.title: Manage virtual machines with the Azure CLI
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the cross-platform Azure CLI to create, start, stop, and perform other management tasks related to virtual machines in Azure.

value.title: Query relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Query relational data in Azure

value.title: Get started with Rust
value.excerpt: Learn how to get started with Rust - set up the environment, write a program, and use the Cargo build system.

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure’s role-based access control to effectively manage your team’s access to Azure resources.

value.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer
value.excerpt: Azure Storage Explorer allows you to quickly view all the storage services under your account. You can browse through, read, and edit data stored in those services through a user-friendly graphical interface.

value.title: How to create a virtual machine in Azure | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: Azure provides multiple virtual machine configuration options for you to set up your virtual machine exactly how you want for whatever you're trying to do. In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to configure a basic virtual machine and connect to it in minutes in the Azure portal.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/rOiSRkxtTeU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to generate SSH public key to log into Linux VM | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to generate SSH public keys to log into a Linux VM with Cloud Shell and BASH on Windows 10. Watch how you can automatically log into a VM without having to put in a password if you SSH into the server.  For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/16bUZ43CGxs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to quickly connect to a Linux VM with SSH | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to quickly connect to a Linux Virtual Machine (VM) with secure shell (SSH). If you have Linux VMs that are running inside of Microsoft Azure, you can easily establish an SSH connection.    For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips/
